maintenanceevent.eventdescription: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday May 18, 2021 at 16:41

did.unittitle: Gardner Family papers, 1892-1994.
did.abstract: The Gardner family collection starts with Rev. John Gardner (1868-1954) and his wife Agnes Annie Gardner (1866-1957). They were married in 1892 and had five children together: Agnes Gardner Buttrick (1893-1990), Annie Gardner Glover (1895-1934), Evelyn Gardner (1897-1990), Gladys Gardner Jenkins (1901-1994) and Rev. John Ashworth Gardner (1904-1990). This collection contains letters, travel notes, finances, writings, wills, chrurch records, birth and marriage certificates, books, postcards and more. Additional information can be found within each series and sub-series.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted and open to the public.

accessrestrict.head: Access for Gladys Gardner Jenkins family
accessrestrict.p: Part of the agreement for accepting this collection was that the descendents of Gladys Gardner Jenkins will have the ability to maintain copies for research or publication of the 3 memoirs in her series (Snippets of Memory, Pinafore Days, and Backwards and Forwards). Verification required. This information can also be found in the collection file.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Items in this collection are subject to U.S. Copyright Law. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine the copyright status of collection items and to secure any permissions necessary for their reproduction and publication. Requests for permission to publish material must be discussed with the archivist or librarian.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the Gardner Family papers, 1892-1994, MS5409. The Congregational Library & Archives, Boston, MA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Collection was donated by Anne Gardner-Remley, granddaughter of Rev. John Gardner, in January 2020. Additional material may come from other members of the family at a later date.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by William McCarthy using DACS Second Edition in April 2021.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Gardner family collection starts with Rev. John Gardner (1868-1954) and his wife Agnes Annie Gardner (1866-1957). They were married in 1892 and had five children together: Agnes Gardner Buttrick (1893-1990), Annie Gardner Glover (1895-1934), Evelyn Gardner (1897-1990), Gladys Gardner Jenkins (1901-1994) and Rev. John Ashworth Gardner (1904-1990). The Gardner family would move from England to the United States in 1913, living in Chicago, California, New York, and Maryland. Rev. Gardner was a Congregational pastor in the various locations his family lived, Evelyn Gardner was the Dean of women at Grinnell College and taught in a variety of schools, Gladys Gardner Jenkins was a writer and radio host, and Rev. John Ashworth Gardner was a presbyterian minister. Other people represented in the collection include Rev. John Ashworth Gardner's wife Dorothy Luther Gardner (1904-1999), Gladys Gardner Jenkins husband, the child psychiatrist Richard Jenkins (1903-1991), Agnes Gardner Buttricks husband, minister Rev. George Buttrick (1892-1980), Annie Gardner Glover's husband, minister and author Rev. Carl A. Glover (1891-1958) and educator and author Gloria Diener (1902-1970), Rev. Carl A. Glover's second wife.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains records from various members of the Gardner Family and includes letters, travel notes, finances, writings, wills, chrurch records, birth and marriage certificates, books, postcards and more. Additional information can be found within each series and sub-series. This collection covers information from Rev. John Gardner, Agnes Baker Gardner, Rev. John Ashworth Gardner, Dorothy Luther Gardner, Gladys Gardner Jenkins, Richard Jenkins, Evelyn Gardner, Agnes Gardner Buttrick, Rev. George Buttrick, Annie Gardner Glover, Rev. Carl A. Glover and Gloria Diener.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has been organized into nine series listed below. Within each series, records have been arranged chronologically.
Series 1: Records of both John and Agnes Gardner, 1892-1957
Series 4: Records of John Ashworth Gardner and Dorothy Luther Gardner, 1904-1990
Series 5: Records of Gladys Gardner Jenkins and Richard Jenkins, 1917, 1931, 1954-1994
Series 6: Records of Agnes Annie Gardner, 1918-1958
Series 7: Records of Agnes Gardner Buttrick and Rev. George Buttrick, 1924-1993
Series 8: Records of Annie (Nan) Gardner Glover, Rev. Carl A. Glover and Gloria Diener Glover, 1934-1943, 1969-1970

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: The collection originally included various genealogical information compiled after the timeframe of the collection. This information does not fit with the actual collection but was kept for future users in the collection file. If you want to view these documents, please ask the staff and they will be happy to provide them.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Thirteen items related to John Ashworth Gardner were sent to the Presbyerian Church of the United States of America in August of 2017. A list of each individual item is available in the collection file and can be viewed by asking the archivist.

did.unittitle: Records of both Rev. John and Agnes Annie Gardner

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records of both John and Agnes Gardner together, including a marriage certificate, letters, notes on trips, disposition of their belongings and a Family Prayer Book.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This letter appears to have been sent to John Gardner from an unknown sender, but this can not be confirmed. The letter is available online at https://archive.org/details/wholeworksofrevj00berruoft/page/354/mode/2up?q=madam. This version is either a draft or the letter we have is a draft. Many parts of the letter are worded diffrently while other part are identical (in comparison to the digital version).

did.unittitle: Records of Rev. John Gardner

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Rev. John Gardner was born in Dalton-on-Furness, Lancashire, England on May 27th, 1868. He moved from England to the United States in 1913. He married his wife, Agnes Annie Gardner, in the town of Poole, England in 1892. They would have five children together, John Ashworth, Gladys, Evelyn, Agnes and Annie. He served as pastor at Redhill Congregational Church in Redhill, England, New England Congregational Church in Chicago, the First Congregational Church in Riverside, California, and the Garden City Community Church in Garden City, New York. He died on April 29th, 1954 in Bethesda, Maryland.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains two sub-series, one of which focuses on personal records and the other which focuses on the religious records of Rev. John Gardner.

did.unittitle: Religious

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains the religious records of Rev. John Gardner and includes letters, sermons, and church records.

scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains the personal records of Rev. John Gardner and includes his birth certificate, letters, travel diaries, writings, will, memorial service and outline of his books.

Records of Evelyn Gardner

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Evelyn Gardner was born on December 16th, 1897 in England. She received a bachelor's degree from Beloit College in 1918 and a master's degree from Radcliffe College. She taught at Carleton College, Pomona College and Grinnell College. In 1933, she became the Dean of women at Grinnell College and stayed there until she retired in 1963. She was a member of Phi Beta Kappa and listed in "Who's Who of American Women and the "Directory of American Scholars". She died on January 23, 1990 in Columbus, North Carolina.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains the records of Evelyn Gardner, including birth certificate, letters, postcards, work from her time at Grinnell College and obituaries.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Grinnell College has a collection on Evelyn Gardner from her time as Dean of Women and Professor of English. The finding aid for that collection is located here: https://atom.grinnell.edu/index.php/evelyn-gardner-papers-1938-1977?sf_culture=en

Records of Rev. John Ashworth Gardner and Dorothy Luther Gardner

bioghist.head: Biographical Notes
bioghist.p: Rev. John Ashworth Gardner was born on November 17th, 1904 in Redhill, Surrey, England. He attended Carleton College in Minnesota and received his bachelor of philosophy from University of Chicago. He would go on to receive his divinity degree from Chicago Theological Seminary. He worked at a variety of churches during his life, including Essex Community church in Chicago, Memorial Presbyterian Church in Midland, Michigan, First Presbyterian Church in Alliance, Ohio and interim minister of Tryon Presbyterian Church in Tryon, North Carolina. He met his wife, Dorothy Luther Gardner, while both attended Carlton College. They had two children together, John L. Gardner and Anne Gardner Remley. He died on August 24, 1990 in Columbus, North Carolina.

Dorothy Luther Gardner was born on June 29, 1904 in Freeborn, Minnesota. She met her husband, John Ashworth Gardner, while both attended Carlton College. They had two children together, Anne Gardner Remley and John L. Gardner. She died on December 14, 1999.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains the records of Rev. John Ashworth and Dorothy Luther Gardner, including letters, postcards, material from Presbyterian churches where John worked, and obituaries.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Material related to Rev. John Ashworth Gardner can also be found at the Presybterian Historical Society. You can find more information here: http://prestohost68.inmagic.com/Presto/home/home.aspx and searching for "135J"

Records of Gladys Gardner Jenkins and Richard Jenkins

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Gladys Gardner Jenkins was born in England on December 14th, 1901. She began her career teaching in Riverside, California. She would go to Chicago for graduate school where she would meet her husband Richard Jenkins. She continued to engage in teaching by writing books and speaking on the radio. She wrote "These Are Your Children" and other books on children and family. Gladys and Richard had three children, Joan, Janet and Jane. She died on July 9th, 1994.

Richard Jenkins was born on June 3, 1903. He was a psychiatrist known for work on child psychiatry and juvenile delinquency. He taught at several schools, including the University of Illinois College of Medicine and the University of Iowa. He also worked for the Veterans Administration as a psychiatric research chief. Richard and Gladys had three children, Joan, Janet and Jane. He died on December 30th, 1991.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records from Gladys Gardner and Richard Jenkins, including letters, notes and three books written by Gladys on her family and life.

bibliography.head: Bibliography
bibliography.p: Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia, s.v. "Richard L. Jenkins," (accessed March 39, 2021), https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_L._Jenkins#cite_note-time1933-1

Records of Agnes Annie Gardner

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Agnes Annie Gardner was born on August 20, 1866 and died in Bethesda, Maryland on July 19th, 1957. She married her husband, Rev. John Gardner, in the town of Poole, England in 1892. She led a Bible class titled "Women of the New Testament". Agnes and John had five children together, John Ashworth, Gladys, Evelyn, Agnes and Annie.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records related to Agnes Gardner, including letters to her children, financial information, a syllabus on "Women of the New Testament" and records related to her estate and obituary.

Records of Agnes Gardner Buttrick and Rev. George A. Buttrick

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Agnes Gardner Buttrick was born on September 15, 1893 in Surrey, England. She married Rev. George Buttrick and they would have three children together, John, George (who went by Robert) and David. She died on May 28th, 1990 in Nashville, Tennessee.

Rev. George Buttrick was born in Northumberland, England on March 23, 1892. He graduated from Victoria University of Manchester in 1915. He worked in several different churches before becoming minister of Madison Avenue Presbyterian Church in New York City. He would then work at Harvard University as preacher to the university and Plummer Professor of Christian morals until his retirement in 1960. He married Agnes Gardner and they would have three children together, John, George (who went by Robert) and David. He died on January 23, 1980 in Louisville, Kentucky.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records related to Agnes Gardner Buttrick and Rev. George A. Buttrick, including letters, postcards, information on house hunting and records related to their children.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Items related to George and Agnes can be found in the George Arthur Buttrick papers at Harvard Library. The link to that finding aid is: https://hollisarchives.lib.harvard.edu/repositories/4/resources/10025.

bibliography.head: Bibliography
bibliography.p: Blumenthal, Ralph. "Rev. Dr. George Arthur Buttrick, Harvard Theologian, Dead at 87". New York Times. January 25, 1980.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Full name was George Robert Buttrick, but most of the material here refers to him as G. Robert Buttrick. His cousin, the donor for this collection, also noted that he was known as Robert throughout his life.

Records of Annie (Nan) Gardner Glover, Rev. Carl A. Glover and Gloria Diener Glover

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Annie Gardner Glover was born on October 17th, 1895. She married Rev. Carl A. Glover and they had one child together, Mary Alnes Glover, in 1922. She died in 1934.

Rev. Carl A. Glover was born on January 21, 1891. He married Annie Gardner Glover and they had one child together, Mary Alnes Glover, in 1922. He would eventually marry Gloria Diener in 1936. He was a Congregational minister who notably worked at the Park Place Congregational Church of Pawtucket. He was also an author of various religious books. He died on February 12, 1958 in Alameda County, California.

Gloria Diener was born on March 20, 1902 in Douglas, Oklahoma. She was an educator and author and worked for the First Presbyterian Church of Oklahoma City and also the International Journal of Religious Education in Chicago. She taught in many schools across Illinois, Minnesota, Ohio and California. She married Rev. Carl Glover in 1936. She died in Monterey, California on April 20, 1970.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series has a copy of Kopje by Annie (Nan) Garder Glover, records related to her funeral, records from her husband Rev. Carl Glover, and records from Gloria Diener Glover.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: We have five items in our collection written by Rev. Carl A. Glover: "With the Twelve", "Prayer for Christian Services", "The lectern; a book of public prayers", "Victorious suffering", and "Messages from the parables: arranged under the theme The Commonwealth of God"

bibliography.head: Bibliography
bibliography.p: "Rev. Carl Archibald Glover obituary". The Times-News. February 26, 1958.
